name: 3.9 "An American Family" Online Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 3 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where did Sam make a reservation?
questions.explanation:
Pequad.

	He and Diane had gone to the Pequad and he thought she might be upset if he went with another woman. Diane told him she didn't care.

questions.text: Who did Sam say dumped him?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	In a previous episode Sam and Carla pretended to be dating so Nick wouldn't think Carla was alone when he got married. Nick asked how it was going and Sam told him that Carla had dumped him and it still hurt.

questions.text: Why did Nick come to Cheers?
questions.correct: He wanted one of his kids.
options: He wanted to fight Sam for Carla.
questions.explanation:
He wanted one of his kids.

	Carla and Nick had five children together and Nick wanted one of them. The names of these five children were Anthony, Seraphina, Gino, Ann Marie, and Lucia.

Loretta.

	This was the reason Nick wanted one of his five children with Carla; Loretta could not have children. Carla told Nick no at first.

questions.text: What did Carla say Anthony called Nick?
questions.explanation:
skuzzball.

	Anthony was the oldest of Carla's children. He remembered the best the day that Nick walked out on the family.

questions.text: Diane asked, "Are you ever pleased at each other's good fortune?" How did Norm reply?
questions.explanation:
"Who's had any?".

	This was a funny side bit in the show where Cliff, Norm and Coach all won and lost money from each other. They were cracking up at how they all lost money, prompting Diane to ask that question.

questions.text: What was Carla going to give to Nick?
questions.explanation:
her son.

	Nick had a way with woman that made it hard for them to say no. Carla especially found it difficult to turn down Nick when he wanted something.

Yes.

	Carla often acted like she could care less about her children. We saw in this episode that she really loved them.

questions.text: Did Carla sign the papers to legally give Nick what he wanted?
questions.explanation:
No.

	In the end Carla stood up to Nick. She kept her son and Nick left without any of their children.

questions.text: Did Nick do his best to get what he wanted, in his words?
questions.explanation:
Maybe.

	Nick realized how much Carla wanted to keep Anthony so Carla said he didn't do his best. He responded with, "Maybe I did, maybe I didn't."
